data.sentence: The word أَنْ comes from the root ا ن and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.
data.sentence: The word قَالَ comes from the root ق و ل and is associated with the meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.

data.meanings: father/grandfather/ancestor, fathership/paternity, to nourish/feed/rear, bring up.
data.sentence: The word أَبُوهُمْ comes from the root ا ب و and is associated with the meanings: father/grandfather/ancestor, fathership/paternity, to nourish/feed/rear, bring up.

data.meanings: to wander, go backwards and forwards. irun - caravan, caravan of camels carrying corn.
data.sentence: The word الْعِيرُ comes from the root ع ي ر and is associated with the meanings: to wander, go backwards and forwards. irun - caravan, caravan of camels carrying corn.

data.meanings: he separated/divided or put apart a thing from another thing, made a separation/partition, distinct/plain/clear/manifest, explain in detail, to distinguish, deciding between two things (e.g. what is true and what is not), distinct portion/section.FASALA: To set apart, separate, distinguish, set a limit, part, depart, decide, set out, divide into parts, expatiate into detail, make clear (statement), distinct, judge, narrate a thing with all its particulars. FASLUN: Distinguishing, DecisiveMUFASSALAN: Clearly explainedFUSSILAT: DetailedMUFASSALAT: Fully detailed
data.sentence: The word فَصَلَتِ comes from the root ف ص ل and is associated with the meanings: he separated/divided or put apart a thing from another thing, made a separation/partition, distinct/plain/clear/manifest, explain in detail, to distinguish, deciding between two things (e.g. what is true and what is not), distinct portion/section.FASALA: To set apart, separate, distinguish, set a limit, part, depart, decide, set out, divide into parts, expatiate into detail, make clear (statement), distinct, judge, narrate a thing with all its particulars. FASLUN: Distinguishing, DecisiveMUFASSALAN: Clearly explainedFUSSILAT: DetailedMUFASSALAT: Fully detailed

data.meanings: to find what was lost, perceive, obtain, find any one or anything (such and such).
data.sentence: The word لَأَجِدُ comes from the root و ج د and is associated with the meanings: to find what was lost, perceive, obtain, find any one or anything (such and such).

data.meanings: Raha - To go or do a thing at evening. Violently windy; good or pleasant wind. Become cool or pleasant [by means of the wind]. Become brisk, lively sprightly, active, agile, or quick [as though one felt the wind and was refreshed by it].Rawahun - he went, journeyed, worked, or did a thing in the evening [or any time of the night or day], or in the afternoon (declining of the sun from its meridian until night).Ruhun - Soul, spirit, vital principle, breath which a man breathes and pervades his whole body. Inspiration or divine revelation [since it is like the vital principle is to the body and quickens man].
data.sentence: The word رِيحَ comes from the root ر و ح and is associated with the meanings: Raha - To go or do a thing at evening. Violently windy; good or pleasant wind. Become cool or pleasant [by means of the wind]. Become brisk, lively sprightly, active, agile, or quick [as though one felt the wind and was refreshed by it].Rawahun - he went, journeyed, worked, or did a thing in the evening [or any time of the night or day], or in the afternoon (declining of the sun from its meridian until night).Ruhun - Soul, spirit, vital principle, breath which a man breathes and pervades his whole body. Inspiration or divine revelation [since it is like the vital principle is to the body and quickens man].

data.meanings: lie, utter a falsehood, to err or make a mistake, weak in judgement, unsound in mind, lack in ability, dotard.
data.sentence: The word تُفَنِّدُونِ comes from the root ف ن د and is associated with the meanings: lie, utter a falsehood, to err or make a mistake, weak in judgement, unsound in mind, lack in ability, dotard.
